messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Censhorship and unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: ... Just to be perfectly clear about the circumstances, he s still signed on as far as I know. (I think I would remember seeing a notice that he d
messages.messageBody:
on 1/7/03 6:32 AM, Helen Hegener at HEM-Editor@... wrote:

> FWIW he's *not* banned. He could rejoin this list anytime he wanted to.

Just to be perfectly clear about the circumstances, he's still signed on as
far as I know. (I think I would remember seeing a notice that he'd
unsubscribed.) He can read here. He's just blocked from posting.

I suspect he's not reading much now, though he indicated on the
HomeschoolFreedoms list that he was at one point. He posted to
HEM-Unschooling for a couple of days (last week?) and then disappeared. So I
suspect he's found outlets that are more in line with what his passion is,
like the more political lists and is using his time up there.

Joyce

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Censhorship and unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: ... FWIW he s *not* banned. He could rejoin this list anytime he wanted to. Helen, who really *is* ceasing discussion of this now
messages.messageBody:
At 11:43 PM -0500 1/6/03, starsuncloud@... wrote:
> Helen made the decision to ban Ned...

FWIW he's *not* banned. He could rejoin this list anytime he wanted to.

Helen, who really *is* ceasing discussion of this now

messages.subject: Censhorship and unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/6/03 5:36:28 PM Central Standard Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/6/03 5:36:28 PM Central Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< Ahh! But I believe the readers are primarily ADULTS and very precocious
children, who don't need You Sandra to close doors for them! >>

Sandra didn't close any doors for anyone!! What are you not understanding
about this? Helen made the decision to ban Ned...she's the list owner.
Could you please let this drop?
Are you Ned under a different identity trying to get stuff stirred up?

Ren
"The world's much smaller than you think. Made up of two kinds of
people--simple and complicated.....The simple ones are contented. The
complicated ones aren't."
"Unschooling support at pensacolaunschoolers.com
